title: Quiz 1 - Profit and Loss
instruction: Given below are two quantities named I & II. Based on the given information, you have to determine the relation between the two quantities.

quiz.text: A man buys an article for Rs. 27.50 and sells it for Rs. 28.60. Find the gain percent?
options: 4%
3%
5%
10%
None of these

quiz.text: If a radio is purchased for Rs. 490 and sold for Rs. 465.50. Find the loss%?
options: 6%
5%
4%
3%
None of these

quiz.text: Find SP when CP = Rs. 56.25 and Gain = 20%?
options: Rs. 72
Rs. 67.5
Rs. 50
Rs. 75
None of these

quiz.text: A discount dealer professes to sell his goods at cost price but uses a weight of 960 g instead of a Kg weight. Find his gain%?
options: 27/4%
8/3%
25/6%
21/4%
None of these

quiz.text: A man sold two cows at Rs. 1995 each. On one he lost 10% and on the other he gained 10%. What his gain or loss percent?
options: 4% gain
2% loss
0.5% gain
1% loss
None of these

quiz.text: Nutan bought a watch with 24% discount. If she pays Rs. 779 for that watch then what is the marked price of watch?
options: Rs. 950
Rs. 975
Rs. 1000
Rs. 1025
None of these

quiz.text: Nutan pays Rs. 2140 for 3 calculator and 4 Pen while he pay Rs. 1355 for an additional calculator and 5 Pen. Then what he paid for Calculator only?
options: Rs. 175
Rs. 480
Rs. 655
Can't be determined
None of these

quiz.text: A vendor bought toffees at 6 for a rupee. How many for a rupee must he sell to gain 20%?
options: 3
4
5
6
None of these

quiz.text: A man sold his two horses for Rs. 770 each, on one he gained 10% & on the other he lost 10%. Find the average gain or loss percentage.
options: 5% gain
0.96% gain
4% loss
1% loss
None of these

quiz.text: If the selling price of an article is  of its cost price the profit in the transaction is
options: None of these

quiz.text: A sells his house worth Rs. 10 lakh to B at a loss of 10%. Later B sells it back to A at 10% profit. The result of the two transactions is?
options: A neither loses nor gains
A loses Rs. 90,000
A loses Rs. 2,00,000
B gains Rs. 1,10,000
None of these

quiz.text: A fair price shopkeeper takes 10% profit on his goods. He lost 20% goods during theft his loss% is?
options: 8%
10%
11%
12%
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya bought 200 dozen orange at Rs. 10 per dozen and he spent Rs. 500 on transportation. He sold each orange at Re 1. What was his profit & loss%?
options: 5% gain
6% loss
4% loss
2% gain
None of these

quiz.text: If 11 Mango are bought for Rs. 10 and sold at 10 for Rs. 11. What was Gain or Loss%?
options: 24%
21%
26%
25%
None of these

quiz.text: The cost price of 20 articles is the same as the selling price of x articles. If the profit is 25%, then the value of x is:
options: Rs. 15
Rs. 16
Rs. 18
Rs. 25
None of these

quiz.text: Abhishek makes a profit of Rs.110, if he sells a certain number of pens he has at the price of Rs. 2.5 per pen and incurs a loss of Rs. 55, if he sells the same number of pens for Rs. 1.75 per pen. How many pens does Abhishek have?
options: 220
240
200
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: Ram purchased a Computer set of Rs. 12500 and spent Rs.300 on transportation and Rs. 800 on installation. At what price should he sell it so as to earn an overall profit of 15%?
options: Rs. 14560
Rs. 14375
Rs. 15460
Rs. 15375
None of these

quiz.text: Mahesh purchased 25 kg of rice at 32 per kg and 15 kg of rice at Rs. 36 per kg. He mixed the two varieties of rice and sold it @ Rs. 40.20 per kg. What is the per cent profit earned?
options: 25
40
30
20
None of these

quiz.text: While selling a watch, a shopkeeper gives a discount of 15%. If he gives a discount of 20%, he earns Rs. 51 less as profit. What is the original price of the watch?
options: Rs. 920
Rs. 985
Rs. 1125
Rs. 1020
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper purchased 245 pieces of an article at Rs. 30 per piece. He spent Rs. 980 on transport and Rs. 1470 on packing the articles. He sold the articles at the rate of Rs. 50 per piece. What is the percent profit earned?
options: 25%
20%
28%
22.5%
None of these

quiz.text: An article is marked for sale at Rs. 504. The shopkeeper gives a discount of 5% on the sale price and still earns a profit of 20%. What could be the purchase price of the article?
options: Rs. 399
Rs. 405
Rs. 403
Rs. 400
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper sold an article for Rs. 400 after giving 20% discount on the labelled price and made 30% profit on the cost price. What would have been the percentage profit, had he not given the discount?
options: 25%
35%
50%
62.5%
None of these

quiz.text: Suresh purchased a TV set for Rs. 11250. He spent Rs. 800 on installation and Rs. 150 on transportation. At what price should it be sold so that the profit earned would have been 15%, if no discount was offered?
options: Rs. 12938
Rs. 14030
Rs. 13450
Rs. 15467
None of these

quiz.text: Mr A sold a goods, to Mr. B at 10% discounted value of printed rate. The discounted value is Rs. 1242. If 15% profit is earned on purchase rate by selling the goods at printed rate, what is the purchase rate?
options: Rs. 1242
Rs. 1380
Rs. 1280
Rs. 1200
None of these

quiz.text: Rajesh purchased a mobile phone and a refrigerator for Rs. 12000 and Rs. 10000 respectively. She sold the refrigerator at a loss of 12 per cent and mobile phone at a profit of 8 per cent. What is her overall loss/profit?
options: Loss of Rs. 280
Profit of Rs. 2160
Loss of Rs. 240
Profit of Rs. 2060
None of these

quiz.text: The cost of an article including the sales tax is Rs. 616. The rate of sales tax is 10%, if the shopkeeper has made a profit of 12%, then the cost price of the article is?
options: Rs. 350
Rs. 500
Rs. 650
Rs. 800
None of these

quiz.text: Two third of consignment was sold at a profit of 5% and the remainder at a loss of 2%. If the total profit was Rs. 400, the value of the consignment was?
options: Rs. 12000
Rs. 14000
Rs. 15000
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: A tradesman gives 4% discount on the marked price and gives one article free for buying every 15 articles and thus gains 35%. The marked price is approximately how much percent above the CP?
options: 20%
30%
50%
40%
70%

quiz.text: When a producer allows 36% concession on the retail price of his product, he earns a profit of 8.8%. What would be his profit percent if the commission is reduced by 24%?
options: 48.2%
49%
49.6%
51%
54.5%

quiz.text: A person earns 15% on investment but loses 10% on another investment. If the ratio of the two investments be 3 : 5, what is the gain or loss on the two investments taken together?
options: 0.625%
0.8%
0.9%
1.2%
1.45%

quiz.text: The profit earned by selling an article for Rs. 900 is double the loss incurred when the same article is sold for Rs. 450. At what price should the article be sold to make 25% profit?
options: Rs. 400
Rs. 500
Rs. 700
Rs. 750
Rs. 900

quiz.text: A shopkeeper sold some article at the rate of Rs. 35 per article and earned profit of 40%. At what price each article should have been sold so that profit of 60% was earned.
options: Rs. 45
Rs. 42
Rs. 39
Rs. 40
None of these

quiz.text: Due to a 20% rise in price of sugar, a bachelor is able to buy 1.5 kg less for Rs. 135. What is the increased price of sugar per kg?
options: Rs. 15
Rs. 21
Rs. 18
Rs. 24
None of these

quiz.text: A trader mixes 26 kg of rice at Rs. 20 per kg with 30 kg of rice of other variety at Rs. 36 per kg and sells the mixture at Rs. 30 per kg. His profit percent is:
options: No profit, no loss
5%
8%
10%
None of these

quiz.text: A TV set is being sold for Rs. x in Chandigarh. A dealer went to Delhi and bought the TV at 20% discount (from the price of Chandigarh). He spent Rs. 600 on transport. Thus he sold the set in Chandigarh for Rs. x making   profit. What was x?
options: Rs. 9600
Rs. 8800
Rs. 8000
Rs. 7200
None of these

quiz.text: If the ratio of the CP of the Daybed and Jukebox is 3:4, find out the discount % of Jukebox?
options: 12%
15%
8%
10%
20%

quiz.text: If the discount % and profit % of the Sofa is same. Find out the MP of Sofa?
options: Rs. 2800
Rs. 2200
Rs. 3500
Rs. 3000
None of these

quiz.text: If the MP of Daybed is Rs. 130 more than the CP of the dining table and the difference between MP and SP of Dining table is Rs. 684. Find the discount % of the Dining table?
options: 18%
25%
30%
20%
None of these

quiz.text: CP of Sofa is how much percent less than the MP of Daybed?
options: 26%
25.04%
29.68%
31%
28.02%

quiz.text: The ratio of discount percent and profit percentage is 4:3 of the Bookcase. Find CP of Bookcase?
options: Rs. 1200
Rs. 2800
Rs. 3500
Rs. 2000
None of these

quiz.text: If the marked price of Saree is Rs. 100 more than the marked price of Shirt. Then find the Selling price of Saree.
options: Rs. 350
Rs. 270
Rs. 583
Rs. 450
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: The cost price of Shirt is how much less than its marked price(in Rupees) if the profit percentage after selling Shirt is double the % discount offered on Shirt?
options: Rs. 20
Rs. 52
Rs. 75
Rs. 83
Rs. 50

quiz.text: Find the difference between Marked Price and Selling Price of Skirts?
options: Rs. 7.5
Rs. 6
Rs. 20
Rs. 68
Rs. 7

quiz.text: Find the profit percentage of Lehenga if the percentage discount of Lehenga is equal to the percentage discount of Skirt and the cost price of Lehenga is 1.5 times the cost price of Kurti.
options: 7%
5%
5(5/9)%
8%
None of these

quiz.text: Find the percentage discount and percentage profit of Kurti?
options: Dis = 10%; Profit = 13(2/3)%
Dis = 25%; Profit = 15%
Dis = 10%; Profit = 18%
Dis = 15%; Profit = 13(1/3)%
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity I Selling price of radio to get gain of  . A dealer sold a radio at a loss of 2.5%. Had he sold it for Rs 100 more, he would have gained .

Quantity II Marked Price of article. A jobber buys an article at Rs. 24 less . He then wishes to sell the article at a gain of  of his cost after allowing a 20% discount on his marked price.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Percentage mark-up above cost price of an article so as to gain 33% after allowing the customer a discount of 5%.

Quantity II: Percentage of dancers under 25 years in a group of 20 singers and 40 dancer if 20% of the singers are less than 25 years old and 40% of the entire group is under 25 years.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Marked price of an article if A tradesman gives 4% discount on the marked price and 1 article free with every 15 articles bought and still gains 35%. C.P. of the article is Rs. 100.

Quantity II: Profit made on selling the pen at marked price. Even after reducing the marked price of a pen by Rs. 32, a shopkeeper makes a profit of 15%. The cost price of a pen is Rs. 320.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I: Overall profit percentage if the cost prices of two shirts are equal. One shirt is sold for 20% profit and the other is sold for 10% loss.

Quantity II: Profit percentage made in selling each meter if the profit made in selling 20 m of a cloth equals the cost price of 5 m of that cloth.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
If the cost price of the article is  of the mark price and there is a discount of Rs. 68 on the marked price. There is a profit of 20% on selling the item.

Quantity I : CP of the article

Quantity II : Rs. 1111
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation
